result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. D'Angelo Lajuan Isreal

records.addlTxt: from Judge Rohl to State's Motion to Amend the Information "approved"
State's Motion to Amend the Information filed by DA Hatch

3:37 PM Defendant D'Angelo Lajuan Isreal in court, in custody.  Attorney Liesl E. Nelson in court for D'Angelo Lajuan Isreal.  Attorney Halle E. Hatch in court for State of Wisconsin. 17CM280 and 18CM3 following along. Atty Nelson believes Defendant wishes to retain private counsel. Defendant is unsure of plans. Court will schedule JT with Atty Nelson's calendar at this time. DA Hatch: 2 day JT. Atty Nelson agrees. Court: counsel may reschedule additional hearings as needed. 3:50

3:37 PM Defendant D'Angelo Lajuan Isreal in court, in custody.  Attorney Liesl E. Nelson in court for D'Angelo Lajuan Isreal.  Attorney Halle E. Hatch in court for State of Wisconsin. 22CF193 set for arraignment and motion hearing, 17CM280 and 18CM3 following. Defendant was provided a copy of the information; information mirrors complaint. Court reads charges and possible penalties. Atty Nelson pleas not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.
Jury trial scheduled for December 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Final pre-trial scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Final pre-trial on November 22, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Jury trial on December 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.

3:41 PM Defendant D'Angelo Lajuan Isreal in court.  Attorney Liesl E. Nelson in court for D'Angelo Lajuan Isreal.  Attorney Halle E. Hatch in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Nelson argues for lower bond on 22CF193 and/or signature bonds, to deal with other issues. DA Hatch objects to bond modification. Court: no new factors set forth. warrants in other jurisdiction. Denies motion for bond modification and bond will continue as previously ordered. 3:45
Speedy Trial Demand filed by Atty Nelson
Information was filed on 9/21. Clerks office received an error and CCAP and help correct the issue.

3:31 PM D'Angelo Lajuan Isreal appears in court in custody, Atty Liesl E. Nelson, DA Halle E. Hatch for the State of Wisconsin Sgt. Logan Dohmeier. S/T. DA Hatch questions Sgt. Dohmeier. Record reflects identification of DE. Cross Atty Nelson. Objection, relevance. Redirect DA Hatch. DA Hatch is requesting the Court find probable cause and bind DE over. Atty Nelson argues, DA Hatch argues. The Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DE probably committed a felony. Court binds DE over for further proceedings. Atty Nelson will file a speedy trial demand and also address bond. DA Hatch argues on hearing the bond matter. ARGN and MH to be heard at the same time. Court adjourned at 3:59 pm.
Motion hearing scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Motion hearing on September 28, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on September 21, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
No contact w/ Alexa Jones, Solvalane Brown or Scott Davis.

11:40 AM Defendant D'Angelo Lajuan Isreal appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Halle E. Hatch in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Liesl Nelson appeared via phone. Defendant has copy of complaint . Court verifies address and DOB. Def qualifies for the PD. Court reads charges and possible penalties. Defendant waives further reading.  Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and constitutional rights.. Defendant understands charges, penalties and constitutional rights. DA Hatch requests $5000 cash bond w/conditions of no contact w/ Alexa Jones, Solvalane Brown or Scott Davis. DA Hatch gives argument for cash bond. Atty Nelson: no objection to a reasonable cash bond; unable to post bond. Nelson: objects to no contact with his family.  Atty Nelson notes Def was incarcerated for a period of time. Court orders $5000 cash bond w/ general bond conditions and with no contact with as requested. 11:56 Court turns down the volume to continue the hearing as Mr. Israel is being uncooperative. Court notes Mr. Isreal has left the jail video conferencing room. Court notes 22cf194 extradition was set for today, moot point with Defendant on a cash bond. Extradition case to be left open.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on September 21, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
